Class amm.mail.POPHandler 
All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index

Class amm.mail.POPHandler 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----java.lang.Thread
           |
           +----amm.mail.POPHandler
public class POPHandler
extends Thread
This class implements the connection to a POP3 server. It must be given a MailSink to supply the server and account information. The MailSink also controls the commands issued to the server.
See Also:
MailSink

in
The input stream from the POP3 server.
line
The last line read from the POP3 server.
message
The output stream used to pass retrieved messages to the MailSink.
out
The output stream to the POP3 server.
sock
The socket used to connect to the POP3 server.
state
The instance that will control the connection to the POP3 server.

POPHandler(MailSink)
Creates a POPHandler with the specified controller.
POPHandler(MailSink, PipedOutputStream)
Creates a POPHandler with the specified controller and output stream.

close()
Closes the connection to the POP3 server.
connect()
The POPHandler uses this method to connect to the POP3 Server.
delMsg()
The POPHandler calls this method to remove messages from the server.
getLine()
Returns a line read from the POP3 server.
newMsg()
The POPHandler calls this method to retrieve new messages from the server.
run()
When the POPHandler is started, it calls runNext() on the MailSink, and processes the next pending request.
setPipe(PipedOutputStream)
Registers the output stream used to send retrieved mail to the MailSink.
stat()
The POPHandler uses this method to check the number of messages on the POP3 server.
uidl()
The POPHandler uses this method to retrieve the SMTP IDs of the messages on the server.

state 
  protected MailSink state
The instance that will control the connection to the POP3 server.
sock 
  protected Socket sock
The socket used to connect to the POP3 server.
in 
  protected DataInputStream in
The input stream from the POP3 server.
out 
  protected PrintStream out
The output stream to the POP3 server.
message 
  protected PipedOutputStream message
The output stream used to pass retrieved messages to the MailSink.
line 
  protected String line
The last line read from the POP3 server.

POPHandler 
  public POPHandler(MailSink state)
Creates a POPHandler with the specified controller.
Parameters:
state - The MailSink that will control transactions with the POP3 server.
POPHandler 
  public POPHandler(MailSink state,
                    PipedOutputStream message)
Creates a POPHandler with the specified controller and output stream.
Parameters:
state - The MailSink that will control transactions with the POP3 server.
message - The output stream used to send mail retrieved from the POP3 server to the MailSink.

run 
  public void run()
When the POPHandler is started, it calls runNext() on the MailSink, and processes the next pending request. This is repeated until the MailSink doesn't have any more requests.
Overrides:
run in class Thread
See Also:
runNext
connect 
  protected void connect()
The POPHandler uses this method to connect to the POP3 Server. It uses several MailSink methods to make the connection.
See Also:
pop3Host, pop3User, pop3Pass
stat 
  protected void stat()
The POPHandler uses this method to check the number of messages on the POP3 server.
uidl 
  protected Vector uidl()
The POPHandler uses this method to retrieve the SMTP IDs of the messages on the server.
Returns:
A Vector containing Strings, each of which is the SMTP ID of a message (in the order they're on the server).
newMsg 
  protected boolean newMsg()
The POPHandler calls this method to retrieve new messages from the server. It uses verify() and remove() on the MailSink to handle this correctly.
Returns:
True indicates an error, which will cause the POPHandler to close.
See Also:
verify, remove
delMsg 
  protected boolean delMsg()
The POPHandler calls this method to remove messages from the server. It uses delWhich() on the MailSink to determine which messages to remove.
Returns:
True indicates an error, which will cause the POPHandler to close.
See Also:
delWhich
getLine 
  protected String getLine()
Returns a line read from the POP3 server. This is a method simply to avoid numerous or unclear try/catch sequences.
Returns:
The line read from the server.
setPipe 
  public void setPipe(PipedOutputStream message)
Registers the output stream used to send retrieved mail to the MailSink.
Parameters:
message - The output stream to the MailSink.
close 
  protected void close()
Closes the connection to the POP3 server.
